title: Jio Financial Services Q3 Results Live: Net profit up 0.3%, AUM hits ₹4,199 cr - Mint
summary:
Jio Financial Services Q3 Results Live Updates

Date: 17 Jan, 2025 | Source: LiveMint

Jio Financial Services reported a 0.3% increase in net profit, reaching ₹295 crore for Q3 FY25, compared to ₹294 crore in the same quarter last year. The company's assets under management surged to ₹4,199 crore from ₹1,206 crore in the preceding quarter.

  • Net profit for Q3 FY25: ₹295 crore
  • Assets under management (AUM) surged to ₹4,199 crore
  • Total income increased by 6% to ₹438 crore
  • Share price remained stable amid previous fluctuations impacting the stock
  • Expansion of the company's digital services and product offerings
“We are expanding our portfolio of services, elevating user experience, and harnessing the power of cutting-edge technology to simplify and personalize financial management for our valued customers.” - Mukesh Ambani

The financial results reveal stable growth amidst market volatility, highlighting the firm's strategic partnerships and service expansions.
newTitle: Jio Financial Services Q3 Results: Net Profit Marginally Increases to ₹295 Crore

Wipro, Tech Mahindra revenue shrinks in Q3 - Mint
summary:
Wipro and Tech Mahindra Face Revenue Decline in Q3 2024

Publication Date: January 2024 | Source: Live Mint

Wipro and Tech Mahindra have reported a sequential revenue decline in the third quarter of fiscal year 2024, indicating ongoing struggles in the IT services sector.

  • Wipro's revenue dropped to $2.61 billion, down 2% from the previous quarter, largely due to weak performance in Europe.
  • Tech Mahindra’s revenue fell to $1.57 billion, a 1.38% decline driven by the telecom sector.
  • This decline marks the worst performance for both companies in at least five years.
  • Wipro’s management remains optimistic about the future, citing potential opportunities in AI spending.
  • Both Wipro and Tech Mahindra reduced their workforce during this quarter, reflecting uncertain demand in IT services.
“Our clients are cautiously optimistic, and we see discretionary spending slowly coming back.” – Wipro CEO Srinivas Pallia

Overall, the revenue contraction across major IT service providers in India suggests wider challenges within the industry.
newTitle: Wipro and Tech Mahindra Face Revenue Decline in Q3 2024

title: Auto Expo 2025 Day 1 highlights: Creta EV, e Vitara steal limelight - HT Auto
summary:
Auto Expo 2025 Day 1 highlights: Creta EV, e Vitara steal limelight

Publication Date: January 17, 2025
Source: HT Auto

The Auto Expo 2025 kicked off with significant showcases in the electric vehicle market, highlighting the Hyundai Creta EV and the Maruti Suzuki e Vitara.

  • Hyundai launched the Creta EV priced between ₹17.99 lakh to ₹19.99 lakh.
  • Skoda introduced the new Kodiaq, Octavia RS, and Superb models for the Indian market.
  • Porsche presented the Taycan facelift and Macan EV.
  • BYD showcased the U8 concept SUV with a quad motor setup producing over 1,084 bhp.
  • Maruti Suzuki debuted the e Vitara, its first electric SUV.
  • Tata unveiled the Avinya X and showcased the production-ready Harrier EV.
“Hyundai aims to lead the Indian electric car market with the Creta EV.”

Overall, Auto Expo 2025 set a robust platform for the future of electric vehicles in India.
newTitle: Auto Expo 2025 Day 1 highlights: Creta EV, e Vitara steal limelight

Nifty 50 Prediction for Monday, Jan 20 (next week): Doji candle on weekly chart! Expect reversal or more selling? - ET Now
summary:
Nifty Prediction for Monday, Jan 20: Doji candle on weekly chart! Expect reversal or more selling?

Updated Jan 17, 2025 by ET NOW

The Nifty 50 index fell on January 17 after a three-day rally, closing at 23,203.20. Analysts predict potential reversal signals and continued bearish sentiment as key support and resistance levels are analyzed.

Key Points:

  • Market fell, Sensex declined by 423.49 points (0.55%) and Nifty 50 by 108.60 points (0.47%).
  • Analyst Jatin Gedia notes that a significant reversal could occur if the index maintains above 23,400.
  • Bearish trends may persist with key levels of support at 23,000 and resistance at 23,400.
  • A doji candle is forming on the weekly chart indicating potential indecisiveness in the current trend.
  • Osho Krishan cites a breakdown below November lows and notices the formation of a 'Falling Wedge'.
“The formation of a Doji candlestick on the weekly chart indicates indecisiveness.” - Osho Krishan

In conclusion, traders should monitor the Nifty 50 levels closely, especially the support at 23,000 and resistance at 23,400, as market trends could shift significantly in the coming days.
newTitle: Nifty 50 Prediction for Monday, Jan 20: Doji Candle Indications

title: Gold sees selling pressure build with weekly gains evaporating ahead of the US session - FXStreet
summary:
Gold Faces Selling Pressure After Rally as Markets Await Fed Decision

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: FXStreet

Gold prices are experiencing selling pressure as traders engage in profit-taking following a strong three-day rally. Federal Reserve comments have triggered uncertainty in the markets, raising questions among traders.

  • After a rally, gold price is struggling to maintain levels above $2,700.
  • Fed Governor Christopher Waller's dovish comments contributed to market jitters.
  • Concerns over upcoming executive orders from President-elect Donald Trump may further impact gold prices.
  • The next pivotal support and resistance levels are identified at $2,671 and $2,721 respectively.
“A March interest rate cut should not be ruled out,” said Fed Governor Waller, spooking traders about potential market shifts.

This current scenario highlights the intricate relationship between gold prices, Federal Reserve policies, and geopolitical developments.
newTitle: Gold Faces Selling Pressure After Rally as Markets Await Fed Decision

title: Indian economy to grow at 6.5% in FY26 and FY27: IMF - Moneycontrol
summary:
Indian economy to grow at 6.5% in FY26 and FY27: IMF

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

The Indian economy is forecasted to grow at 6.5 percent for FY26 and FY27, according to the latest report by the International Monetary Fund (IMF). This projection holds steady from previous updates despite recent economic slowdowns.

  • The IMF maintains the growth forecast at 6.5% for the next two fiscal years.
  • The organization estimates a slight increase from the government's projection of 6.4% for FY25.
  • India's growth dipped to 5.4% in Q2 FY25, marking a low not seen in seven quarters.
  • Previous fiscal growth was at 8.2%, highlighting a significant slowdown.
“In India, growth is projected to be solid at 6.5 percent in 2025 and 2026, as projected in October and in line with potential,” - IMF.

Looking forward, these growth estimates reflect both challenges and potentials for the Indian economy in the coming years.
newTitle: Indian economy to grow at 6.5% in FY26 and FY27: IMF

title: Union Cabinet approves Aircraft Leasing Bill to Boost Indian aviation - BusinessLine
After bus fare hike, Bengaluru Metro fare to increase as BMRCL board gives nod - Moneycontrol
summary:
Bengaluru Metro Fare Set to Increase Following Bus Fare Hike

Date: January 17, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) board has approved a proposal to increase metro fares, likely to take effect from January 20.

  • The BMRCL board met on January 17 to review fare adjustments.
  • A senior BMRCL official confirmed the fare hike following recommendations from the Fare Fixation Committee.
  • This decision follows recent fare hikes in bus transportation across the city.
"The board has given its approval to the recommendation of the Fare Fixation Committee (FFC) to revise the fares. We will soon announce the revised fare structure," said a senior BMRCL official.

This fare increase reflects ongoing adjustments in Bengaluru's public transport pricing.
newTitle: Bengaluru Metro Fare Set to Increase Following Bus Fare Hike

title: Wipro Q3 attrition rate rises to 15.3%; headcount down by 1,157 to 2,32,732 employees - Mint
summary:
Wipro Q3 attrition rate rises to 15.3%; headcount down by 1,157 to 2,32,732 employees

Publication Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Wipro Ltd reported a voluntary attrition rate of 15.3% for Q3 of the financial year 2024-25, up from 14.2% in the same quarter last year. The company’s headcount decreased by 1,157 to a total of 2,32,732 employees.

  • Consolidated net profits increased by 24.5% YoY to ₹3,353.8 crore.
  • Revenue from operations rose nearly 1% to ₹22,319 crore.
  • Wipro declared an interim dividend of ₹6 per equity share, with a record date set for January 28, 2025.
“In a seasonally weak quarter, our strong in-quarter execution helped us deliver above the top end of our revenue guidance,” said Srini Pallia, CEO.

The company's shares dropped 2.15% to ₹281.85 ahead of the earnings announcement.

This increase in attrition and decrease in headcount suggests ongoing challenges in workforce retention within the IT sector.
newTitle: Wipro Q3 Attrition Rate Increases to 15.3%, Headcount Decreases

Jio Financial Q3 Results | Net profit flat at ₹295 crore, revenue up 6% to ₹438 crore - CNBCTV18
summary:
Jio Financial Q3 Results | Net profit flat at ₹295 crore, revenue rises 6% to ₹438 crore

Date: Jan 17, 2025

Source: CNBCTV18

Jio Financial Services Ltd (JFSL) reported a net profit of ₹294.8 crore for Q3 FY25, reflecting a marginal increase of 0.3% year-on-year, while revenues rose 6% to ₹438.4 crore.

  • Share price of JFSL closed at ₹279.05, up 0.83%.
  • The company's assets under management (AUM) increased significantly to ₹4,199 crore.
  • JFSL's customer base for CASA grew by 25% quarter-on-quarter to 1.89 million.
  • JFSL integrated payment solutions into JioBharat, enhancing its digital footprint with 7.4 million monthly active users (MAUs).
  • Marketing partnership established with MyJio app for customer acquisition.
“Shares of Jio Financial Services Ltd ended at ₹279.05, up by ₹2.30, or 0.83%, on the BSE.”

JFSL's results show steady growth despite flat profits, indicating a strong position in the digital finance sector.
newTitle: Jio Financial Q3 Results: Flat Net Profit and Rising Revenue

title: Sebi opposes KOEL’s appeal on family settlement disclosure advisory - Mint
summary:
Sebi Opposes KOEL’s Appeal on Family Settlement Disclosure

Publication Date: Not provided
Source: Live Mint

The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has opposed an appeal from Kirloskar Oil Engines Ltd (KOEL) regarding the disclosure of the Deed of Family Settlement (DFS). The conflict stems from a family agreement outlining management and control among Kirloskar family branches.

  • Sebi's advisory is deemed an administrative order, making the appeal unmaintainable.
  • The DFS, signed in 2009, details ownership distribution among Kirloskar entities.
  • The dispute over the DFS has been ongoing since 2016 among Kirloskar siblings.
  • KOEL argues the DFS does not impose obligations; hence, disclosure is unnecessary under regulations.
  • A hearing for the case is scheduled on April 7.
“The advisory was not time-bound and Sebi ought to be given a chance to respond to the appeal.” - Shiraz Rustomjee

In conclusion, the case highlights the importance of full disclosure in corporate governance and its implications for family-owned businesses.
newTitle: Sebi Opposes KOEL’s Appeal on Family Settlement Disclosure

title: Citi initiates coverage on Aadhar Housing Finance stock with ’buy’ rating, sees 42% upside - Mint
summary:
Citi Initiates Coverage on Aadhar Housing Finance with Buy Rating, Projects 42% Upside

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Live Mint

Aadhar Housing Finance stock has received a 'buy' rating from Citi Research, reflecting a target price of ₹565 per share, indicating a potential growth of 42% from its current price of ₹398.

  • Citi projects Aadhar's growth at over 16% CAGR in the past 4-6 years.
  • The company commands 2% market share in the low-income housing finance segment.
  • Post-Blackstone acquisition, Aadhar has improved governance and growth metrics.
  • Plans to open 75 new branches in FY25 across various states.
  • Expecting disbursement growth to sustain AUM CAGR at 21-22%.
“The brokerage expects the share of self-employed customers to scale up by 1-2 percentage points annually over the medium term.”

Despite recent stock declines, Aadhar's stock remains up 26.3% from its IPO price of ₹315.
newTitle: Citi Initiates Coverage on Aadhar Housing Finance with Buy Rating, Projects 42% Upside

Kalyan Jewellers Shares Fall 37% From All-Time Highs; Why Is The Stock Losing Its Shine? - News18
summary:
Kalyan Jewellers Shares Fall 37% From All-Time Highs; Why Is The Stock Losing Its Shine?

Date: January 17, 2025
Source: News18

Shares of Kalyan Jewellers India Ltd have continued to decline despite the company denying rumors of IT raids and allegations of bribing fund managers. The stock started 2025 on a high note but has been on a downward trend, falling in 10 out of 13 sessions this year.

  • The stock dropped 6.63% on Friday, reaching a low of Rs 503.25, marking a 36.66% decline from its record high of Rs 794.60.
  • The stock has fallen in four out of five sessions this week.
  • Kalyan Jewellers is currently in "oversold" territory, with a Relative Strength Index (RSI) at 21.
  • The market capitalization has dropped from over Rs 82,000 crore to Rs 50,000 crore.
  • The company denied allegations of IT raids and labeled bribery rumors as “absurd.”
  • Recent financial measures include repayments of around Rs 450 crore of debt and a Rs 170 crore dividend payout.
  • The stock is approaching a key support level of Rs 515.
  • Kalyan Jewellers shares have delivered a positive return of 39% over the past year, with multibagger returns of 320% and 626% over two and three years, respectively.
“We have always maintained a high level of integrity and transparency in our business operations.” - Ramesh Kalyanaraman, executive director.

This decline in stock price indicates potential challenges for Kalyan Jewellers, despite past success and positive returns in a longer timeframe. Investors are advised to approach cautiously and stay updated on future developments.
newTitle: Kalyan Jewellers Shares Fall 37% From All-Time Highs; Why Is The Stock Losing Its Shine?

title: 'Unacceptable': TMC MP Mahua Moitra demands refund of Rs 1,220 from Swiggy; company responds - The Times of India
summary:
TMC MP Mahua Moitra Demands Refund of ₹1,220 from Swiggy

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Mahua Moitra, a Member of Parliament from the Trinamool Congress (TMC), has publicly demanded a refund of ₹1,220 from the food delivery service Swiggy due to unsatisfactory service, prompting a response from the company.

  • Moitra criticized the service provided by Swiggy in her recent complaint.
  • The demand has generated considerable media attention and public discussion.
“This is unacceptable service, and I demand a refund.” - Mahua Moitra

Swiggy has acknowledged the complaint but has not yet confirmed whether the refund will be issued.
newTitle: TMC MP Mahua Moitra Calls for Refund from Swiggy

title: Tech Mahindra Q3 Results Highlights: Net profit jumps 93% YoY to ₹983 crore, revenue up 1.4% - Upstox
summary:
Tech Mahindra Q3 Results Highlights: Net Profit Surges 93% to ₹983 Crore

Date & Source: January 17, 2023 | Tech Mahindra

Tech Mahindra has reported significant financial growth in Q3 FY25 with a 92.63% increase in net profit and a slight revenue growth amid fluctuating market conditions.

Key Points

  • Net profit rose to ₹983.2 crore, up from ₹510.4 crore YoY.
  • Revenue for the quarter reached ₹13,286 crore, a 1.4% YoY increase.
  • EBITDA increased by 57.8% to ₹1,809 crore.
  • Manufacturing sector declined by 7.2%, while BFSI segment grew by 8.3% YoY.
  • New deal wins increased to ₹74.5 crore compared to previous quarters.

Notable Quotes

“We delivered growth in EBIT margin and operating PAT, resulting from our targeted actions under Project Fortius,” said Rohit Anand, CFO.
“Our consistent expansion in operating margins reaffirms that we are on track to achieve our long-term goals,” said Mohit Joshi, CEO & MD.

Conclusion

Despite minor sequential declines, Tech Mahindra's substantial YoY growth illustrates a strong financial performance and commitment to strategic growth across key verticals.
newTitle: Tech Mahindra Q3 Results Highlights: Net Profit Surges 93% to ₹983 Crore

title: WazirX freezes first set of stolen funds worth $3 million - BusinessLine
WazirX freezes first set of stolen assets worth $3 mn - BusinessLine
summary:
WazirX Freezes $3 Million of Stolen Cryptocurrency Assets

Updated - January 17, 2025 | Source: The Hindu Business Line

Six months after a significant cyberattack, WazirX announced the freezing of $3 million of stolen assets, moving closer to recovering funds for victims affected by the breach.

  • The theft on July 18 resulted in losses exceeding $230 million.
  • The cyberattack has had a negative impact on confidence in India's cryptocurrency ecosystem.
  • WazirX's parent company is collaborating with international law enforcement regarding the theft.
  • The attack has been attributed to North Korean hackers by several countries including the US, South Korea, and Japan.
“This is just the beginning; we are fully committed to recovering the stolen funds,” says Nischal Shetty, Founder of WazirX.

WazirX continues to work diligently to recover stolen assets and stabilize their cryptocurrency exchange operations.
newTitle: WazirX Freezes $3 Million of Stolen Cryptocurrency Assets

title: Q3 Results Live Updates: Wipro Q3 profit jumps 24.66%; Tech Mahindra profit zooms 92.63%; Jio Financial Services, others to release their Q3 results today - The Financial Express
summary:
Q3 Results Live Updates: Wipro Q3 profit jumps 24.66%; Tech Mahindra profit zooms 92.63%; Jio Financial Services, others to release their Q3 results today

Date: 17 Jan 2025 | Source: Financial Express

The latest updates from the third quarter results show significant profit increases from major IT companies, with Wipro reporting a profit of Rs 3366.70 crore, up 24.66% YoY, and Tech Mahindra posting a profit of Rs 983.2 crore, reflecting a 92.63% increase compared to the previous financial year.

  • Wipro's revenue from operations reached Rs 22,318.80 crore.
  • Tech Mahindra's revenue from operations was Rs 13,285.60 crore.
  • Both companies are part of a broader trend in the IT sector seeing recovery from previous quarters.
  • Other companies, including Jio Financial Services and SBI Life, are also set to release their Q3 results.
“We expanded margins for a fourth consecutive quarter,” said Wipro's CFO Aparna Iyer.

The continued recovery in IT services indicates a positive outlook for the industry despite ongoing economic challenges.
newTitle: Wipro and Tech Mahindra Report Strong Q3 Earnings
